What a ride this game was, I have never played half-life I heard about the game from so many people but never got around to play it, until I saw that valve complete pack was on a huge sale so I bought it, and boy oh boy does this game keep its promises, the game is not that long (around 8-12hrs depending on you're play style), the game did age well it wasn't unplayable I had a few graphical issues here and there, but in overall I think that everyone should give half-life a chance the game is great and the story is interesting, I suggest that you wait for the game to go on sale, you can get it for dirt cheap but for a 21 year old game I guess you can pay 8€ if you're really eager to play it, but in overall I give half-life an 8/10 (March, 2019)...

You can now play this Classic on Android thanks to Xash3D FWGS app:  https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=in.celest.xash3d.hl&hl=en .

All you need is to buy this game here and copy the 'valve' folder from your Steam install to your Android device.  It's simple to setup, just read the Xash3D instructions, which are very clear.

Blue Shift is also playable on Android, just buy it here on Steam and copy bshift to your Android device and get the BSLauncher app: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=in.celest.xash3d.bshift&hl=en/

I loved this game back when it came out, but now it seemed boring, after all these years.  The sequels are more modern after all.  But playing this on my Android tablet is just a blast!  What a treat!!

"Un antes y después en la historia de los fps", pasando de matar por diversión en juegos como Doom, Quake, etc. a un juego con un entorno completamente realista y vivo, con una historia, aun que algo simple, atrapante y da motivos a todo lo que hacemos dentro del juego, la inteligencia artificial de los enemigos es muy buena para su época, y un buen punto a destacar es que este juego jamas necesito una cinematica para contar su historia, siempre estas bajo el control de Gordon Freeman y logras sentir que eres parte del juego, cosas que muchos videojuegos no son capaces de hacer a día de hoy, a mas de 20 años de la salida de este videojuego.
Precursor de un gran cambio en el mundo de los videojuegos.
10/10: Se nota mucho el amor que le dio Valve a este juego y merece ser jugado por toda persona a la que le interese los videojuegos.
BEST GAME EVER

Gameplay:
Great (bit tedious at the Xen part sometimes)
Story:
Immersive. Ends on a cliff-hanger.
Atmosphere:
(This is a mini-catagory section)
Xen: It looks like it's an alien planet.
Black Mesa: Yep, that's a research facility that has been bombed to shreds.
Surface: Mhm, military guarded place alright.
Lambda Lab: Yep, that's a room before a hard and tedious area.
Nihalith's Chamber: ...yeah that's a final boss room.
Controls:
I like how the crouch-jump is just embraced by the game.
Not sure if it's a bug or a intended mechanic though.
Also, the way your momentum stays when you jump is great sometimes too.

Overall:
I recommend this. It's brilliant.
rhenj

I've heard of Half-Life since I was in junior high. I finally bought the Half-Life Bundle. At first, I was skeptical about it. It looked old and not polished. However, hours passed, and I found myself kinda addicted to it. It's an old game. The control feels sloppy, the graphics are not good, but I was enjoying every minute of it. I haven't seen the ending yet, but I will see it soon. This is the best classic FPS Sci-fi game I've ever seen. I can see my future self playing this again.

Bence herkesin en azından bir kere bile olsa denemesi gereken bir oyun. Zamanında FPS tarihi için öncülük yapmış bir oyun. Ayrıca oyundaki kurgular çok iyi olduğu için sizi oyun içine çekiyor ve cidden kendinizi Gordon Freeman'ın yerine koyabiliyorsunuz.(Karakterin kendi fikirlerini belli etmemesi de bu yüzden.) Buda oyunu oynarken oyun hakkında düşüncelerinizi ve teorilerinizi oluşturmanızı sağlıyor ve size çok güzel bir oyun deneyimi yaşatıyor.
Classic FPS, but fairly difficult.

It's old but it's gold. The game aged really well, it's still fun, challenging, the graphics are ok for today's standards, the gameplay is old but nothing clunky or troublesome. If you played this a lot (like myself), you can finish it very quickly, but if you never played or played just a few times, you can get some 8h, 10h of gameplay. I recommend this, even knowing that we'll never see the Half-Life³ (at least an official Valve version of it)

Bir dönemin internet cafelerini zengin etmiş, öğrencilerini sınıfta bırakmıştır bu oyun. Ailelerine çocuklarını fellik fellik aratmıştır. Şakası bir yana ciddi anlamda başlayalım.

Half Life, bir gizli araştırma üssünde meydana gelen bir kaza sonucu ortaya çıkanları anlatan, bunları kahramanı Gordon Freeman'ın gözünden anlatan 1998 yapımı bir FPS oyunudur. Kısaca bahsetmek gerekirse, spoiler vermemeye çalışarak, araştırma üssüne bir taş benzeri bir madde ulaşmıştır, maddenin uzaydan geldiği varsayılmaktadır ve M.I.T'den mezun olan Gordon Freeman'ın ekibi olan olağandışı maddeler ekibine üzerinde deney yapılması adına verilmiştir. Ardından yapılan deneyde bir aksaklık olur ve macera başlar.

Half life eski ancak şuandaki hikayeli FPS oyunlarının temelini oluşturan ve klasik oyunların arasında yer almış bir oyundur. Akıcı hikaye ve oynanışı ile insanı etkiliyor Half Life. Grafikleri ve oyun motoru da zamanına göre çok iyidi.

Oyunun havası oldukça kasvetli. Her an her yerden saldırabilecek düşmanlar, her tarafta onun dışındaki cesetler, çok az canlı insan, havalandırmalarda geçen yollar,kısıtlı cephane.. Oyun atmosfer olarak size o an oradaki insanın psikolojisi nasıl olursa aynen onu yaşatmakta. Karakter Gordon Freeman ise soğukkanlı ve kolayca bağ kurulabilecek bir karakter. Kısacası oyunu oynamaya başladığınızda kendinizi oyunun içerisinde hissedeceksiniz.

Artılar (+) :

- Akıcı hikaye ve oynanışı
- Gerilim hissi
- İlk Hikayeli FPS oyunu

Eksileri (-) :
- Öğrencileri etkisi altına alıp başında saatler geçirtmesi ve bunun sonucunda öğrencilerin sınıfta kalması :D (Yok yok bu eksi olarak sayılmıyor :P)


Not : 95/100

[h1] My Personal Review of Half-Life 2 [/h1]

I am going to try to keep this review solely based on Half-Life 2, but because this is an episodic game with 2 expansions proceeding it, it will be nearly impossible for those to not have at least a small impact on my overall review (however this should not matter as the gameplay is nearly identical, and it follows one continuous story arc). I will also make a few statements about Half-Life as a whole, which will also factor in the first game and its expansions, as they are related to this game. However, for the most part, this is going to be a raw review of [b] Half-Life 2. [/b] 

The events of Half-Life 2 take place 20 years after the events of the first game. Despite this being a sequel game, it is not difficult to follow along with. The game has its own individual story that is separate from the first one. Although certain dialogues and callbacks may be confusing, they are not essential to the overall progression of the game. Meaning that this game is a great introduction to the Half-Life series, even in the event that you have never played any part of the games that came before it. The story is easy to follow throughout the entire game, and not hard to digest. There are no obvious plotholes or inconsistencies in the story, and it is never unclear how to progress, as you always have a clear objective or defined path. This is [i] not [/i] stating that the puzzle aspects of the game are not challenging to solve, or can lead to the player being unsure of where exactly to go in a radius, or not immediately knowing how to reach a certain path. The puzzles are unique, and unlike any other game, even to this day, with the impressive physics engine that the game created, and takes advantage of. Many of the puzzles require you to think logically, and imagine this were a real life situation, while still taking into account the fictional elements of the game. The physics in this game were revolutionary for its time, and surpassed all other games of the time. The physics the game brought to the table was not the only thing that the game excelled in. Despite the age of the game, the graphics are astonishing, and comparable even to some modern games. Despite this, the gameplay is far from modern, and that's not necessarily a bad thing. First-person combat and gunplay are huge aspects of the game. They are done in a unique way that can not experience in any other game. The AI of each NPC responds to different situations on how they act, between taking cover, rushing you, flanking you, or anything else. The enemy variety is also very diverse, and it is a hell of an experience to fight all of the different kinds of enemies this game has to offer. Despite all of the diversity among enemies, they all feel as though they fit into the world you are thrown into. The world itself is incredibly well thought out, and rich with lore. I won't go much into this, but the post-apocalyptic wasteland that you seemingly find yourself in is unlike any other, and feels incredibly foreign and unique in a perfect way. Apart from enemies, there are friendly NPC characters that you can recruit to follow you and aid you on your endeavors. There is not much to the ally NPCs. They are willing to aid you in combat, provide you with medkits (if they have medical knowledge), and respond to basic commands such as waiting or following you. Overall, the game is a unique and fun experience that I would recommend to anyone, especially if they were looking for an in-depth story with lovable characters  and rich lore. I personally think that the idea of the game, and the story itself are the best parts about this. The game has its flaws, just as any game does, however the revolutionary advancements this game brought onto the table, and the one-of-a-kind story that it introduced outweighs every negative aspect of this game. There is a reason Half-Life is one of the most widely appreciated and most successful video-game series' of all time.

Juego Nostalgico, me siento viejo xd

Where do I begin...
Let's start with the story. Pretty basic, but well-written nonetheless. It's a FPS, so obviously you're gonna have to get used to blasting countless mobs with assault rifles (or crowbars). What I DIDN'T expect was platforming. Platforming in a late-90's FPS is not fun. At all. But if you can get by the incessant slipping-off-the-edge gimmicks, then enjoy. Also, the game seemed to get very... redundant after a while. Here's the bad guy, shoot him. Again and again and again. I know it's an FPS, but it's a very LONG FPS, and the lack of memorable characters really didn't help. If there was at least one lasting character that didn't either die within 1 minute of meeting him or just couldn't accompany you after a short walk, then I would have enjoyed the game much more. But still, it is a pretty good game, especially for the time period.

Definitely one of the best games ever made.

它已经不需要评价了。

Lo menos que podemos decir es que Valve (empresa fundada, recuerda, por dos ex alumnos de Microsoft) golpeó duro al ofrecernos este FPS que, incluso hoy en día, sigue siendo una referencia. Combinando un entorno digno de un Resident Evil con una jugabilidad perfecta, tiene la gran ventaja de proporcionar un escenario real lleno de giros, causando una inmersión total que realmente te pone en los zapatos de Gordon Freeman. Un juego para adquirir A-B-S-O-L-U-M-E-N-T para todos los felices propietarios de una PC más poderosa que una Pentium 2 (¡dado que el software incluso permite el lujo de encender las máquinas más modestas!).

[u] [b] A Cynical Review: Half Life [/b] [/u]

[b] Is There A Plot?: [/b]
You are Gordan Freeman, the physicist and it is just another day at the office. Just another 5 hour train ride into Black Mesa. Just another day… guns, aliens, explosions, portals into a different dimension, then the army shows up, more explosions, giant psionic baby boss, and Lambdas galore. You know, usual physicist stuff.

[b] Is This Even Fun?: [/b]
For a  game that came out in 1998, you will be shocked to find out that in the modern day it holds up amazingly well. Apart from dated graphics, it plays great, almost like Halo: Combat Evolved (which came out in 2001…). You don't have vehicles to drive or Covenant to fight in Half Life, but outside of that: the level design and even just the way Valve made Freeman progress and interact with in the world was very well done.

[b] Is It Worth Buying?: [/b]
This game is dirt cheap on the Steam Store and I highly recommend you buy this. If you do not own this, or you have it sitting unplayed in your library; seriously consider giving this game a try!

[b] 8/10 [/b]
